duties_responsibilities.duty: Review and analysis of the initial pleading, overseeing calendaring of critical deadlines, filing of an answer, including identification of appropriate affirmative defenses.
Developing and implementing an appropriate discovery plan, including oversight and preparation of discovery responses for review by partner and then client.
Review and understand litigation documents including claim files, medical records and other documents typically gathered in litigated matters.
Preparation of initial report and budget for ultimate review and approval by supervising partner.
Recommendations for and drafting of discovery motions and handling argument of same.
Identification of critical legal issues to move case to a conclusion in consultation with supervising partner.
Attend and conduct fact witness and some expert witness depositions, which may include travel.
Preparation of dispositive motions for review and approval by partner as requested by supervising partner.
Legal research and preparation of legal memoranda as requested by the client and directed by the supervising partner.

education_certification.credential: Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree from an American Bar Association accredited law school
